abstract: Editorial argues right to bear arms must remain qualified one, and supports communities that recognize their right, and duty, to determine what is necessary for the safety of their citizens; urges California and other states to ignore absolutist cries of gun lobby and uphold reasonable controls over process of issuing concealed-carry permits.
lead_paragraph: There is no justification for scuttling the right of communities to require a “good cause” before granting a license to carry a concealed weapon.

headline.main: A Sensible Question for Gun Owners
headline.print_headline: A Sensible Question for Gun Owners

snippet: There is no justification for scuttling the right of communities to require a “good cause” before granting a license to carry a concealed weapon.
